On Wed, Oct 2, 2013 at 6:32 PM, Walter Christman <president@globalstrategicanalysis.com <mailto:president@globalstrategicanalysis.com>> wrote:Dear Sara, Thank you for your very informative call. I passed everything you emailed me to Tom Hazard and he should be in contact with you. Please do also reach out to him if he needs a reminder to schedule in follow up, as I know he is quite busy now.. Per our discussions, attached are two documents that I am using for contractor support, that I would welcome your comment and review on. One is a certification that the person is an independent contractor and not an employee. The other is a non-compete and non-disclosure agreement. In the Individual Contractor agreement, I propose to replace for all people I bring to you the language in paragraph 2 which states that payment will be made: " On an individual client project basis in which he will receive a proportion of the funding received from the client on terms to be agreed upon separately in each instance and client. Each project payment agreement will be managed as an addendum to this agreement." Instead, I would like your suggestion of alternate wording that would tie them to MBO partners. I think that adequate wording might be: "James Jin would receive payment on an individual client project basis by enrolling with MBO Partners as an independent consultant for payment to be agreed upon separately in each project instance. Each project payment agreement will be managed by MBO Partners as a client of GSA. For general information, see Annex A." Annex A would be the attached MBO document. In addition, please see the attached Non-Disclosure Agreement, which I would like each to sign for my own protection. However, as these personnel are actually your employees, I need to know how these documents relate to your own company's liability. One way this non-disclosure document differs from the other is that it doesn't specify which State the law falls under. Perhaps it should? I used Rocket Lawyer to generate both of these, and will also have foreign employees, notably in China sign them. Those people of course don't come under MBO, but how do I manage this issue regarding those that do? Please advise. Thank you! Walter -- WALTER L.
